 Based in Stockholm, Lumera has significant presence with offices in the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Norway, Sweden, India and Vietnam.
   

  

 Lumera is majority owned by Monterro, a leading Nordic software investor.
   

  

 www.lumera.com
   

  

 Follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook.
   

  

 We are Lumera - pioneering the digital transformation of the Life and Pensions industry. With strategic partnerships and advanced automation, we streamline policy administration, making complex processes simpler. Our mission, The Prudent Revolution, guides L&P providers through change, ensuring a smooth transition. Trusted for migrations and armed with deep domain expertise and innovative AI solutions, Lumera shapes the future. Join us on this innovative journey!

title: Erfarna IT-supporttekniker till Södertälje
description:
Har du ett genuint intresse för IT och människor samt praktisk erfarenhet av IT-support? Då är det dig vi söker!
 



  





 Vi arbetar med flera kunder i Södertälje som regelbundet har behov av kompetenta IT-supporttekniker. Det innebär att vi inte söker till ett specifikt uppdrag just nu, utan vill komma i kontakt med dig som är intresserad av framtida möjligheter.
 



  





 Som konsult på Eccera får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som IT-Supporttekniker blir du en viktig del av våra kunders servicedesk. Dina arbetsuppgifter innefattar, men är inte låsta till:
 


* Ta emot och hantera supportärenden via telefon, fjärrstyrning och ibland onsite
* Arbeta främst i Windowsmiljö, men även Mac kan förekomma
* Registrera ärenden i ärendehanteringssystem
* Felsöka hårdvara, mjukvara, nätverk och kundspecifika system
* Installera program och kringutrustning
* Utföra enklare felsökning på servrar vid behov



  





**Din profil** 




  





 För att trivas i rollen som IT-supporttekniker:
 


* Du motiveras av att ge service i toppklass
* Du har minst två års erfarenhet från servicedesk
* Du är självgående, noggrann och social
* Du uttrycker dig flytande på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift



  





*Krav* 



* Minst två års erfarenhet av arbete i servicedesk
* Kunskap inom Active Directory och Microsoft 365
* Erfarenhet av felsökning i Windows- och Macmiljö
* Grundläggande kunskaper inom serverhantering (Windows)



  





*Meriterande* 



* Erfarenhet av Azure
* B-körkort



  





 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Eccera får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi sätter stort värde på att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar.

title: DevOps Engineer for Telecom OSS Fulfilment & Inventory (Ericsson Granite, Java)
description:
**About the job** 




  





**Role:** 
 DevOps Engineer for Telecom OSS Fulfilment & Inventory (Ericsson Granite, Java)
 



**Experience:** 
 6+ Years
 



**Language requirements:** 
 Swedish + English
 



  





**Tata consultancy Services** 
 is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




  





 Join a high-performing telecom engineering team as a DevOps Engineer, where you will drive CI/CD automation, infrastructure modernization, and operational excellence across BSS/OSS systems. You will work on large-scale telecom platforms including billing, CRM, provisioning, and network management while enabling faster releases, high availability, and resilient operations. This role offers deep exposure to Kubernetes, cloud environments, automation frameworks, monitoring tools, and multi-vendor telecom ecosystems in an Agile and DevOps-driven environment.
 



  





**Key Job Responsibilities:** 



* Support Ericsson Granite for network discovery and synchronization with Adaptive Inventory.
* Automate workflows for resource modeling, topology updates, and service provisioning.
* Maintain integrations between Inventory, Fulfilment, and OSS/BSS systems using REST/SOAP APIs.
* Tune JVMs, Granite configurations, and orchestration workflows for high-volume provisioning.
* Implement resilience patterns (timeouts, retries, circuit breakers) in deployment configs.
* Configure proactive alerts for failures in discovery, provisioning, and CI/CD pipelines.



  





**Experience & Skills Requirements:** 




**Must have:** 



* Hands-on experience with Ericsson Granite and OSS Inventory concepts.
* Strong programming skills in Java and JavaScript for customizations and integrations.
* Expertise in CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps).
* Familiarity with Linux, scripting (Shell), and containerization (Docker/Kubernetes).
* Understanding of telecom OSS Fulfilment & Inventory processes and TM Forum standards (SID, eTOM).



  





**Good to have:** 



* Exposure to Ericsson Adaptive Inventory (EAI) and orchestration engines.
* Experience with Elastic/Kibana or similar observability tools.
* Knowledge of Camunda BPM or workflow engines for O2A orchestration.



  





**Success Metrics & Unique Selling Proposition (USP) of The Role:** 



* Faster and more reliable software delivery through automated CI/CD and containerized deployments.
* Improved system stability, uptime, and SLA performance in large-scale telecom environments.
* Strong impact on cost reduction and operational efficiency through automation and infrastructure-as-code.
* Ability to lead modernization of BSS/OSS platforms using Kubernetes, cloud, and advanced monitoring tools.
* Act as a key driver connecting development, operations, and architecture teams for DevOps excellence.



  





**What we offer / What’s in it for you:** 



* Opportunity to work on large-scale telecom platforms with modern DevOps and automation technologies.
* Exposure to cloud, Kubernetes, monitoring ecosystems, and next-gen BSS/OSS modernization initiatives.
* Collaborative environment with cross-functional and global engineering teams.
* Continuous learning and career growth supported by certifications and complex project exposure.
* Ownership of strategic DevOps initiatives with direct impact on operational performance and delivery speed.



  





**Does that sound interesting?** 




  





 You are welcome to submit your application consisting of your CV, personal letter, relevant degrees or certifications details, professional references, etc. We work with ongoing recruitment so send in your application as soon as possible.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application via LinkedIn or mail to
 **aswini.ranganathan@tcs.com** 




  





**Privacy Note: https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice**

title: Network Security Engineer Check Point
description:
*Som Network Security Engineer inom Check Point på Tele2 befinner du dig inom teknikens framkant! Vi erbjuder dig en spännande roll där du får arbeta med att utveckla, leverera och drifta verksamhetsanpassade och flexibla lösningar till våra kunder.* 
*För att tillgodose och möta våra kunders behov så behöver vi säkerställa att vi har marknadens vassaste nätverksspecialister inom säkerhet, kompetensutveckling är därför en stor del av Tele2:s erbjudande till dig, där vi möjliggör tid för utbildning och nya certifieringar.*
 På Tele2 Företag (B2B) arbetar vi varje dag för att möjliggöra ett samhälle med obegränsade möjligheter genom vår breda portfölj av it- och telekomrelaterade produkter och tjänster. Med ett team av kunniga experter hjälper vi kunder inom privat och offentlig sektor att digitalisera sin verksamhet, bli mer hållbara och uppnå sin affärspotential. Vi söker nu en ny medarbetare till vårt framgångsrika team som bidrar till vår tillväxt, förstklassiga kundupplevelser och högt engagemang.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Denna roll tillhör Security Solutions, ett team som ansvarar för design, leverans, drift och underhåll av avancerade nätverkssäkerhetslösningar. Med vår unika kompetens inom Networking levererar, utvecklar och driftar vi verksamhetsanpassade och flexibla lösningar till våra företagskunder i hela Sverige.
   

  

 Som Network Security Engineer inom Check Point kommer du arbeta med att drifta och utveckla vår externa Check Point tjänst och även hantera övriga större kundplacerade Check Point lösningar. Du kommer att vara en del av vårt landsomfattande team. I rollen kan det finnas möjlighet att gå med i beredskap på rullande schema.
   

  

 Det här är en tillsvidareanställning och vi erbjuder en hybrid arbetsplats, tjänsten är placerad på vårt huvudkontor i Kista, alternativ Göteborg, Malmö, Karlskoga, Sundsvall eller Norrköping.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att du skall trivas och bli framgångsrik i denna roll ser vi att du:
   

  

* har en bred erfarenhet av arbete med Check Points produkter och innehar certifieringar.
* har en eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant område eller motsvarande kunskaper inhämtade genom praktisk yrkeserfarenhet.
* kan utrycka dig i väl i skrift och tal på såväl svenska som engelska.
* är svensk medborgare då du kan komma att behöva arbeta med säkerhetsklassad information.


 Meriterande:
   

  

* vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av projektarbete.


 Vi letar efter dig som har ett eget driv och ett konsultmässigt förhållningssätt. Du klarar att prioritera i ett högt tempo och kan kommunicera på ett bra sätt med ditt team, användare och leverantörer. Du bör ha ett stort intresse för teknik och systemlösningar. Vidare ser vi att du är strukturerad, analytisk och har en mycket god samarbetsförmåga. Arbetet bedrivs i högt tempo med snäva tidsramar i en föränderlig och mångfacetterad systemmiljö, vilket ställer krav på att du är prestigelös och drivande. Du kan och uppskattar att arbeta med ett stort mått av frihet under ansvar.

title: Infrastructure Lead
description:
Intric is accelerating its growth, driven by a fresh round of funding from investors and strong demand from both existing and new customers.
   

  

 Our platform - Intric.ai - is currently transforming how work is done, primarily within the public sector and companies that value data sovereignty, by making the power of AI accessible to a wider audience. We have secured a market-leading position in a niche of this segment.
   

  

 We are seeking a motivated individual eager to embark on the journey of a lifetime with our expanding and driven team.
   

  

**Your role**
 As an Infrastructure Lead, you will be owning the infrastructure as we embark on this next step of our journey.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 You will have full ownership of the infrastructure, from how it scales to how we roll out updates, and everything in between. This means:
   

  

* Design the architecture from the ground up.
* Ensure stability of the delivery.
* Ensure security of the infrastructure.
* Work closely with product developers to ensure maximum speed of development.


**Ideal Candidate Profile**
**Core qualities**
* Intelligent and execution-focused, with a passion for delivering results.
* Driven by challenges and adept at overcoming technical hurdles.
* Excellent communication skills.


**Cultural attributes**
* Committed to our long-term vision and willing to grow with the organization.
* Passionate about building extraordinary solutions from the ground up.
* Collaborative team player who excels in competitive environments.


**Qualifications**
* BSc or MSc in Computer Science or related field.
* Four or more years of professional experience.
* Demonstrated interest and enthusiasm for artificial intelligence technologies.
* Evidence of completed projects demonstrating technical expertise.
* Examples of overcoming specific technical challenges with tangible solutions.
* A track record that showcases initiative and contributions beyond typical job requirements.


**What We Offer**
* Be a part of a visionary and driven team establishing the future of AI in Europe.
* Freedom with responsibility. We trust you to deliver the end result, the how is up to you.
* Competitive compensation package combining salary and stock options.


**Our tech-stack**
**Infrastructure**
 Docker, Redis, pgvector, Arq, vLLM, Kubernetes
   

  

**Other Important Tools / Techniques**
 Linux, Bash, Domain-Driven Design

title: Engineer - Mobile & Beyond - Audiobooks
description:
In the Audiobooks Mission, we're looking for a Software Engineer II to be a founding member of a new full-stack squad. This squad will be a bit unique, as it will span a number of products and areas of expertise – helping us explore opportunities as they come up in the audiobooks space. There will be multiple technologies at play, and an expectation that everyone on the team supercharges their T-shaping (including the EM!).
   

  

 The audiobooks industry is heating up as a result of our entry, and we want to keep up our momentum! Come join us and help do that.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Embody our engineering philosophy of “anything is possible”
* Actively participate in and manage all phases of development from design to post-deployment issue resolution
* Work closely with product, design, and other engineers to rapidly deliver impactful software
* Collaborate regularly with other team members at all stages of product development and launch
* Contribute to both mobile and non-mobile initiatives, applying your expertise where it brings the most value
* Focus on high quality, high-velocity feature delivery, maintaining the balance between maximizing business impact and minimizing technical debt


 Who You Are
   

  

* You thrive working within a fast-paced, high-growth, startup-type environment
* You have a sense of humor, have fun on the job, and embody Spotify's "playful" value
* You can deliver features on both Android and iOS, and are equally comfortable contributing to non-mobile projects when needed
* You are able to, willing to, and excited about expanding beyond your core areas of expertise
* You have 3+ years of software engineering experience
* You get excited about challenging software design problems, and have a love of clean code
* You have a strong foundation in software architecture, performance and optimization, data structures, and design patterns
* You have excellent communication skills, and the ability to collaborate with team members across all functions of the company
* You have a persistent/determined work ethic and a willingness to try anything and everything


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Senior/Staff Data Engineer (Fintech team) (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description:
****About Agoda****
 At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.
   

  

 Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.
   

  

 No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If you’re ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.
   

  

****About Agoda****
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world
   

  

**Get to Know Our Team**
 Fintech is a rapidly expanding industry with endless opportunities for growth and innovation. At Agoda, we are proud to be at the forefront of this exciting field, working closely with our finance business team and product owners to reduce risk, increase efficiency, and seize new market opportunities. Our fintech projects are diverse and varied, ranging from traditional finance to cutting-edge customer-facing solutions. Whether using big data technologies for reconciliation, expanding and enhancing payment options for our customers, or developing lightning-fast tax calculation systems, we are constantly pushing the boundaries of what's possible in fintech. With a talented team of data and backend engineers, we are well-equipped to tackle any challenge that comes our way. Agoda is the perfect place for you if you're passionate about fintech and looking to make a real impact in this dynamic industry.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 We are seeking highly skilled engineers with a range of experience in fintech to join our team. Whether you are a seasoned expert or just starting out in the field, we welcome your application. We are looking for intelligent and agile engineers with strong attention to detail and the ability to work on both back-end and data engineering tasks. If you have a passion for fintech technology and are excited about the opportunity to build and innovate, we would love to hear from you. We value a wide range of experience and backgrounds and encourage all qualified candidates to apply.
   

  

**In this Role, you will get to**
* Think and own the full life cycle of our products, not just a single piece of code – from business requirements, technology selection, coding standards, agile development, unit and application testing, to CI/CD and proper monitoring
* Design, develop and maintain platforms and data pipelines across fintech
* Improve scalability, stability, and efficiency of our existing systems
* Write great code and help others write great code – mentor people in your team and the wider organisation
* Collaborate with other teams and departments
* Help us hire extraordinary talent such as yourself!


****What You’ll Need To Succeed****
* Minimum 7 years of experience under your belt developing performance-critical applications that run in a production environment using Scala, Java, C# or Kotlin
* Experience with data tooling: Spark, Kafka, Workflow Orchestration Tools
* Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
* Experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets. In depth knowledge of Model and Design of DB schemas for read and write performance.
* Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
* Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
* Experience supporting and working with Scrum in Agile Cross-functional teams.
* Excellent verbal and written English communication skills


**It's great if you have**
* Deep experience with spark based distributed data pipelines. Able to deep dive and solve challenges in spark query plans and optimize code. Experience in Spark streaming is a plus
* Strong experience building finance stack applications including ledgers, revenue recognition, monetary transfers and reconciliations, financial accounting platforms etc.
* Experience handling financial data risk management and data governance projects.
* Experience supporting internal and external financial audits
* Experience with data profiling, data lineage, data cataloging to enhance data governance and documentation
* Experience in leading projects, initiatives and/or teams, with full ownership of the systems involved
* Experience with building data pipelines to integrate 3rd parties is plus.

* YouTube https://www.youtube.com/agodalife


**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy.
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

title: Account Manager
description:
Office Solution växer och söker nu dig som vill starta eller fortsätta din karriär inom B2B-försäljning av IT- och kommunikationslösningar.
 





 Du behöver inte vara färdig – det viktiga är att du har rätt inställning, vilja att lära och ambition att lyckas.
 




  






 Hos oss får du en tydlig introduktion, utbildning inom IT & kommunikation och stöd i hela säljprocessen. Du arbetar med efterfrågade lösningar mot företag och bygger långsiktiga kundrelationer tillsammans med ett erfaret team.
 




  






 Vi söker dig som:
 



* Har ett intresse för försäljning, IT och affärer
* Är driven, målmedveten och vill utvecklas inom B2B-försäljning
* Trivs med kundkontakt och är bekväm med telefon och möten
* Är ansvarstagande, strukturerad och vill ta eget ansvar över tid
* Har ambition att bygga upp och utveckla ett eget kundområde



  






 Vi erbjuder:
 



* Grundlig introduktion och säljutbildning inom IT & kommunikation
* Löpande coaching och stöd från erfarna säljare
* Tydlig affärsprocess och verktyg för att lyckas
* Goda möjligheter till utveckling och karriär inom bolaget
* Fast ersättning kombinerat med prestationsbaserad provision



  




* B-körkort är ett krav.
* Vi sitter i fräscha lokaler i Årsta



  






 CV är inte avgörande för oss, ta kontakt så tar vi ett första samtal och bokar ett möte om det känns rätt. Vi anställer omgående!
 




  




* Skriv några rader till: jobb@officesolution.se

title: Technology Manager for e/Bio-fuels
description:
**Company Description**
 AFRY provides engineering, design, digital and advisory services. We are devoted experts in industry, energy and infrastructure sectors, creating impact for generations to come. AFRY has Nordic roots with a global reach.
   

  

 Our shared principles - Results driven, Client Centric, Empowering and Accountable - guide us in how we work, grow and succeed together. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable society.
   

  

**Job Description**
 AFRY Chemical & Biorefining Sweden is seeking a
 **Technology Manager for e/Bio-fuels & Refining processes** 
 to join our
 **Power-to-X** 
 team. We are looking for a professional with solid experience in
 **E-fuel production, Bio-fuel production, and Green Hydrogen** 
 technologies. Significant experience from (bio)refinery processes is meritorious.
   

  

 As
 **Technology Manager** 
 , you will be part of a structured and collaborative engineering team, working closely with AFRY’s global network. Our mission is to serve diverse industries with a strong focus on
 **renewable fuels** 
 and
 **decarbonization.**
***The Power-to-X group operates across sectors such as:***
* E-fuels (e.g., e/Bio-SAF, methanol, SNG, HVO, hydrogen)
* E-ammonia
* Green steel
* Gas infrastructure
* Renewable electricity generation
* Logistics


 AFRY has played a key role in driving the growth of these industries in the Nordics and globally. In this position, you will contribute significantly to further developing this sector.
   

  

***The key responsibilities of the role are:***
* Drive the strategic development of AFRY’s Power-to-X service portfolio, with a focus on e/Bio-fuels.
* Lead process teams during project execution and support project management.
* Contribute to sales, marketing, and business development activities. This may include participation and representation of AFRY at international conferences and to publish articles within the field.
* Collaborate with an international team of AFRY experts to deliver innovative solutions.


 At AFRY, you will join a dynamic and international work environment where collaboration and innovation are at the core of everything we do. You will have the opportunity to shape the future of renewable fuels and decarbonization, working alongside leading experts and global clients. We offer a setting that encourages professional growth, knowledge sharing, and the chance to make a real impact in one of the most transformative sectors of our time.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 To be successful in this role we believe that you recognize yourself in this description:
   

  

* Senior Process Engineer, >10 years project experience
* Previous background in chemicals engineering or energy sectors
* Hands-on experience of technologies within gas-to-liquid, biorefining, refining, reforming and electrolyzers
* Extensive experience and knowledge of the key suppliers (OEMs) of technology and plant design
* Good understanding of the global e-fuel market
* Project experience in conceptual, basic and detailed engineering within relevant sectors
* Ability to develop new solutions and approaches in a client-oriented manner
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Chemical Engineering or within a relevant field of technology
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills in English language
* Proficiency in Swedish is an advantage


 You are fully supported by multi-skilled colleagues and our international project base provides an opportunity for further professional growth. We are committed to ensure your well-being at work and induct you profoundly to our business.
   

  

 We take your personal qualities in great consideration. Our shared principles -
 **Results driven, Client Centric, Empowering** 
 and
 **Accountable** 
 characterize how we see ourselves. You have a good ability to collaborate and contribute to a team, at the same time you enjoy when you have responsibility and the opportunity to affect.
   

  

 The position is in Sweden and possible locations are
 **Stockholm, Gothenburg** 
 , or
 **Malmö.**
**Additional Information**
 We provide you with a unique global role supported by 19.000 colleagues in consulting, design, engineering and project implementation.
   

  

 Our work is demanding, but it is accompanied by freedom – freedom to develop and learn, and to combine professional and private life into a fulfilling match.
   

  

 We at AFRY want to build a better future and find the best solutions, serving our clients but also the wider society. We are a modern employer strongly driven by our values based on long-term sustainability. Read more about AFRY and what our employees tell about their work https://afry.com/en/join-us/get-know-us/meet-our-people
   

  

 At AFRY, you will have the opportunity to benefit from:
   

  

* An individual competence development plan within your area of expertise
* Competitive benefits regarding pension, wellness, and parental leave, regulated by our collective agreement
* Corporate discounts with external partners through our benefits portal: Benify
* Wellness allowance of 4500 SEK per year
* Access to an extensive network of technical experts


 Welcome to submit your application, the deadline is
 **2026-01-16**
**Contact information**
 Emil Lillieblad
   

  

 Group Manager Power-to X
   

  

 +46 72 201 98 18
   

  

 emil.lillieblad@afry.com
   

  

 Marcus Högberg
   

  

 Vice President & Head of Chemicals & Biorefining Sweden
   

  

 +46 73 385 52 55
   

  

 marcus.hogberg@afry.com
   

  

 We kindly ask not to be contacted by staffing and recruitment agencies or salespeople offering additional job advertisements.
   

  

*At AFRY, we engineer change in everything we do. Change happens when brave ideas come together. When we collaborate, innovate technology, and embrace challenging points of view. That’s how we're making future. We are actively looking for qualified candidates to join our inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable future.*

title: Product Sales Specialist, Nordics
description:
**Our Company**
 Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.
   

  

 We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 From the moment you wake up in the morning until you go to bed at night consider the media you consume, the adverts you see, the apps you use, the websites you browse and almost all of the shopping you do online throughout the day. Chances are that every single one of those interactions, every single one of those experiences, was touched by an Adobe product.
   

  

  

  

 We have a fantastic opportunity for a Product Sales Specialist to join our Digital Experience sales team in Stockholm!
   

  

  

  

 We are looking for a high energy individual with an ambitious spirit and proven track record of success selling in the tech solutions space to join this outstanding team as Product Sales Specialist on Data&Insight, Profile & Activation and Marketing Automation solutions. We're seeking individuals who have enterprise level software solutions sales experience to large enterprises. The Product Sales Specialist also participate in finding leads, in the development of presentations and sales propositions, negotiates pricing and contractual agreement to close the sale, be the spokesperson to different events.
   

  

  

  

**What You'll Do**
* Run an enterprise sales territory focusing on net new business
* Develop target named account strategies and tactical penetration plans
* Develop and maintain relationships at the “C” and “VP” levels of the defined target named accounts
* Develop compelling value propositions based on return on investment cost/benefit analysis
* Complete the major steps of the sales process including finding new business opportunities, qualifying new opportunities, and closing new business
* Sell against annual revenue targets for software licenses and services
* Coordinate with pre-sales and professional services teams
* Contribute creative ideas and participate in marketing events
* Provide accurate and timely sales forecasts
* Develop, maintain and strengthen third party relationships
* Present to external events


  

  

**What You Will Need**
* Demonstrated sales track record with Tier 1 and Tier 2 customers (8-10 years’ experience)
* Understanding of various industries dynamics, Omnichannel challenges, related cost drivers, and customer needs
* Understanding of the Digital Data&Insight, Marketing Automation and CDP landscape (challenges, competition) within the Nordic market
* Experience with insight selling methodology
* Be able to work with prospects to understand their business requirements and value models
* Ability to quickly adapt and then clearly articulate value propositions
* Ability to work cross functionally and collaboratively to bring in the right resources to bear at the right stage in the selling process
* Experience and success in selling high value, long lead time enterprise solutions software ($500K and above)
* Excellent new business development skills and sales quota attainment track record
* Mentality of a creative self-starter; shows initiative and resourcefulness to find a way into the prospect
* Strong skills in the following: communication, presentation skills, negotiation, organizational and attention to detail & high collaboration skills, resilience
* Proficient networker. Ability to develop and use relationships with senior industry leaders and key influencers
* High comfort level and presence with senior executives
* An accomplished history of selling multi-level to business, technical, IT people, and C-level executives


  

  

 At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our outstanding Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.
   

  

 If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

We do not discriminate based on gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law. Learn more.

title: Supporttekniker – framtida möjligheter!
description:
Är du en serviceinriktad och lösningorienterad IT-tekniker som vill utvecklas i din karriär? Vi samarbetar med flera företag i Uppsala med omnejd som regelbundet har behov av skickliga supporttekniker på olika nivåer. Därför söker vi dig som vill hålla dörren öppen för nya möjligheter och som är redo att ta nästa steg när rätt uppdrag dyker upp.
 



  





 Som konsult på Eccera får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 I rollen arbetar du med IT-support på olika sätt, antingen som onsite-tekniker där du ger support på plats eller via telefon där du supporterar via fjärrstyrningsverktyg.
 



  





*Behovet kan variera, men rollerna innebär oftast:* 




 • Felsökning och support inom IT-miljöer
 



 • Hantering av klienter, servrar och nätverk
 



 • Support via telefon, mail och/eller på plats
 



 • Installation, konfiguration och underhåll av system och applikationer
 



  





**Din profil** 




 För att vara aktuell för tjänsten ser vi gärna att du har arbetat med liknanade arbetsuppgifter i minst ett år. Du har god förståelse för Windows-miljöer, Microsoft 365 och nätverk. Som person är du serviceinriktad och trivs med att hjälpa användare.
 



  





**Krav** 




 • Relevant utbildning inom IT eller annan erfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig
 



 • Erfarenhet av Active Directory och Microsoft 365
 



 • Goda kunskaper inom Windows
 



 • Flytande svenska och engelska – i både tal och skrift
 



  





**Meriterande** 




 • Erfarenhet av Azure
 



 • B-körkort
 



  





 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Eccera får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi sätter stort värde på att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar.

title: Test and Verification Engineer for 9Air Combat Management System
description:
*Passionate about making ideas a reality? Join our welcoming world of tech and let your ideas soar.*
 Your Role
   

  

 At Product Unit Air C4I, we develop and maintain the Combat Management System 9Air. This product is used for real-time surveillance and combat management in the national airspace. As an example, the product presents a situational picture presented on top of a map, where the operator can follow all objects in the national airspace in real time. The product also includes the 9Air Trainer, which is a simulator and training system.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Test and Verification Engineer to join our growing team. In this role, you will play a critical part in ensuring the quality and functionality of our systems, with a primary focus on system and Graphical User Interface (GUI) testing.
   

  

 As a Test and Verification Engineer, you will develop a good understanding for how the customer uses our product. In this role, you will be responsible to:
   

  

* Design, develop, and execute test plans and test cases.
* Use various testing methodologies, including black box, white box, and exploratory testing, to identify and report defects.
* Collaborate closely with development teams to understand software requirements and translate them into testable user cases and scenarios.
* Analyze test results, and provide test reports.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of testing processes and methodologies.
* Support with customer training activities.
* Contribute to the writing of our training materials and user manual.


 Your profile
   

  

 Saab is growing quickly and are open to both junior and senior applicants. By working as a team in collaboration with colleagues, we can adapt your tasks and responsibilities to fit your current experience. We understand that junior applicants may not yet have all of the qualifications listed below.
   

  

 Here are relevant background qualifications:
   

  

* Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field in engineering or defense.
* Experience of software testing or software development.
* Understanding of Systems Engineering.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Comfortable speaking in front of a group, like when showing customers how to use our product.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Ability to speak English and Swedish fluently, and ability to write technical documentation in English and Swedish.


 The following qualifications are meriting but not strictly required:
   

  

* Experience in writing system requirements and breaking these requirements into detailed test cases.
* Experience from automated testing using e.g. Robot Framework or similar frameworks.
* Experience with test management tools (e.g., Jira).
* Experience of combat management systems and the defense industry.
* Experience of team leading and agile ways of working.


 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

 What you will be part of
   

  

 Explore a wealth of possibilities. Take on challenges, create smart inventions, and grow beyond. This is a place for curious minds, brave pioneers, and everyone in between. Together, we achieve the extraordinary, each bringing our unique perspectives. Your part matters.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 26,100 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

 Recruiting manager: Henrik Frid

title: Cashier Stockholm
description:
**Description**
 Ria Money Transfer, a business segment of Euronet Worldwide, Inc. (NASDAQ: EEFT), delivers innovative financial services including fast, secure, and affordable global money transfers to millions of customers along with currency exchange, mobile top-up, bill payment and check cashing services, offering a reliable omnichannel experience. With over 600,000 locations in nearly 200 countries and territories, our purpose remains to open ways for a better everyday life.
   

  

 We believe we can create a world in which people are empowered to build the life they dream of, no matter who they are or where they are. One customer, one family, one community at a time.
   

  

**About This Role**
**Ria Financial Services is looking for a driven and service-oriented employee for the role of Sales Cashier/Store Employee. We are a global leader in money transfers and currency exchange with an extensive network of our own offices and branches.**
**This is a part-time position located in Stockholm, starting around mid-December. As a Sales Cashier/Store Employee, you will be a central part of our team and the face of our business. You are responsible for providing an outstanding customer experience while contributing to achieving our sales goals.**
**Roles & Responsibilities**
* Carry out transactions for money transfers and currency exchangewith high precision and efficiency.
* Actively engage customers to understand their needs and offer appropriate financial services.
* Provide personalized and professional serviceby answering questions and providing clear guidance.
* Manage cash flow carefully and ensure accurate accounting according to company guidelines.
* Help achieve and exceed sales goalsby building trust and customer loyalty.
* Be flexible with working hours and be able to work evenings, weekends and holidays when needed.


**Position Requirements**
* Has experience in sales and customer service(meritorious).
* Fluent in Swedish and English – additional language skills are a plus (e.g., Bangla, Arabic, Russian, Ukrainian).
* Is self-motivated, goal-oriented and thrives in a dynamic work environment.
* Have a strong customer focusand the ability to create a positive experience for our customers.
* Has experience in cashier work and handling of cash(meritorious).
* Is flexible and can adapt to different tasks and shifts. Weekend work occurs.
* Have basic computer skills(Word, Excel).


**Perks & Benefits**
* An exciting and dynamic work environment in an international company.
* Opportunity to develop in sales and financial services.
* An inclusive and multicultural team where we value diversity.


 Ria Money Transfer is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
   

  

 Check out our website to learn more about the company at:
 **http://www.riamoneytransfer.com/**
 The position responsibilities outlined above are intended to define the general contents and requirements to perform this job. It is not to be taken as a complete statement of responsibilities or requirements. This job description does not restrict the Company’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job as needed.

title: Marketing Automation Manager
description:
**THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELL**
**You?** 
 A data-driven and solution-oriented
 **CRM/ Marketing Automation Manage** 
 r who thrives in a dynamic, cross-functional environment.
   

  

**Role?** 
 Own and drive marketing automation strategies for the
 **Nordic Mobility vertica** 
 l, working closely with stakeholders to enhance user engagement and optimize marketing automation initiatives
   

  

**Company?** 
 Vend, home of FINN, Blocket, Tori, Oikotie, DBA & Bilbasen, where millions of people across the Nordics connect to find what they need, whether it’s a job, a home, a way to move, or a fresh start.
   

  

**Location?** 
 Join us in our Oslo/Stockholm office with the flexibility to work 50% remotely: your choice, your balance.
   

  

**Why us?** 
 This is your chance to join our Centre of Excellence in marketing automation, driving high-impact initiatives, collaborating with diverse teams, and shaping the future of marketing automation in a multi-brand, multi-country setting.
   

  

**Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!**
**WHO ARE YOU?**
* You have solid experience working with CRM/Marketing Automation platforms, defining data needs, product requirements, and business cases for multi-channel marketing automation
* You are familiar with the data flows needed to build data-driven marketing automation solutions. You’re on top in always measuring your work through continuous analysis and experimentation.
* Experience in Braze, our main B2C user engagement platform, is a big plus!
* You have confident communication in English, comfortable working with multiple stakeholders across different teams and countries.
* You thrive in a collaborative and knowledge-sharing team culture but can also take ownership of your vertical, ensuring marketing automation initiatives align with business goals.
* As a person, you have a strategic and leaning-forward mindset, able to define key user journeys and implement scalable marketing automation strategies across multiple markets, focused on finding solutions even when things are not set in stone.


**WHAT’S THE JOB LIKE?**
**Day-to-day work & projects cooking**
 As our new Marketing Automation Manager, you are joining our User Engagement Team: our mission is to proactively plan marketing automation journeys and initiatives supporting multiple verticals (aka, business areas). In particular, you are the main contact point for the Mobility Vertical, which includes the marketplaces that help you find a new vehicle to move, like Blocket in Sweden.
   

  

**Your mission?** 
 To proactively plan, execute, and optimize marketing automation strategies that drive user engagement and business growth: you focus on defining the most important user journeys in relation to Vertical business goals and marketing automation initiatives to support these journeys while keeping in mind the Nordic perspective where these initiatives would be scalable across different countries.
   

  

 You communicate and collaborate closely with the Vertical marketing squad and the Vertical product and tech teams to define marketing automation needs and support the implementation of these needs, both regarding our existing platforms and planning for our future common marketplaces platform into which the Mobility Vertical will transition in the near future.
   

  

 Succeeding in this role requires an independent and proactive attitude while working with your dedicated Vertical. Supporting you in this journey would be a team of other marketing automation experts, our Nordic CRM Lead and marketing data & analytics experts working with various initiatives and our other verticals
   

  

**The challenge to turn into an opportunity!**
 This role presents a unique opportunity to shape the future of marketing automation as we transition towards a more unified platform. The complexity of working with multiple brands, platforms, and markets requires adaptability and strategic thinking, but also provides a chance to drive meaningful change and set new standards for our user engagement excellence.
   

  

**A few words from** 
***(manager)***
**,**
 Hi there, my name is
 **Tarun Tolia (** 
 https://www.linkedin.com/in/tarun-tolia/), Head of User Engagement and Marketing Analytics, and hiring manager for this role. Join our team and help make smart choices easier for our Nordic customers through powerful, data-driven marketing automation.
   

  

*Want to get a feel for our culture and what drives us? Take a peek behind the scenes at our* 
*Career Page* 
*!*
**GOT YOUR ATTENTION? Let us hear from you!**
 Please apply by
 **Friday, January 9** 
**, 2026** 
 . You can choose whether to send your cover letter or go through some questions we prepared to get to know you better :) To give everyone a fair shot, we will start reviewing applications after the deadline.
   

  

**QUESTIONS?**
**Tarun Tolia** 
 (tarun.t.tolia@vend.com) is happy to provide information about the daily work and answer any questions you may have about the role. You can also reach out to the Senior TA Partner,
 **Clayton Don Corda** 
 (clayton.don.corda@vend.com), on the recruitment process

title: Regulatory Compliance Risk Officer
description:
Are you interested in securing that Swedbank is on top of external regulatory requirements and identifies and understands the Regulatory Compliance Risks in an effective way?
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Identify, assess and report on the regulatory compliance risks across risk types in the Group risk taxonomy.
* Be an important part of and contribute to central processes related to regulatory compliance in Swedbank, including:
* Regulatory screening, including development of the Regulatory Inventory encompassing the universe of external regulatory requirements and assigned ownership of the implementation of such requirements in the bank.
* Regulatory interactions, ensuring an aligned, effective and professional approach to the interactions with regulators.
* Develop and maintain an active dialogue and exchange with relevant stakeholders across the Group around regulatory compliance risks.


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g. economics, legal or mathematics).
* Experience (preferably 5+ years) from non-financial risk or regulatory compliance risk.
* Demonstrated strong analytical skills and ability related to the development of identification, assessment and reporting of non-financial risks or compliance risks.
* Demonstrated ability to develop and maintain effective stakeholder management, including communication (written and verbal), presentation and collaboration skills.
* Solution oriented, with aptitude and talent for identifying improvement areas and together with other team members or stakeholders actively driving and securing development.
* Drive and passion to contribute to effective delivery of value-added outcomes, which enable the Group to take on a forward-looking and proactive approach to compliance and risk management.


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

 become an important member of a team of experts, who have the central task of keeping track of and ensuring that the Group has an effective aggregated oversight of regulatory compliance risks and compliance with external regulatory requirements and supervisory interactions related to licensed operations in the jurisdictions where it is present.
   

  

 The team is actively working to identify improvement areas of the Compliance programme across the Group” -
 **Anna Andersson,** 
**your future manager.**
 We look forward to receiving your application by 18.01.2025.
   

  

****Location:****
**Sundbyberg, Sweden**
**Recruiting manager:** 
**Anna Andersson, +46 (0)73 367 89 89**
 We will begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.
   

  

****Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: AI Solution Architect
description:
På Iver brinner vi för innovation och stark laganda. Vi söker nu dig som vill vara med och realisera kunders idéer med hjälp av AI – och skapa verkligt affärsvärde. Är du vår nya kollega?
   

  

**Iver - We empower our Nordic society**
 Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation. Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort. Med huvudkontor i Stockholm verkar Iver främst i Norden med en agenda att fortsätta expandera. Iver omsätter drygt 3 miljarder SEK och har cirka 1 500 anställda som arbetar på ett av våra 25 kontor i Norden.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Vår AI‑satsning kombinerar Microsoft Copilot/Azure AI med Sovereign/Open‑source AI för att skapa praktiska, säkra lösningar med tydligt resultat. Vi bygger referensarkitekturer, AI agenter och managerade tjänster med suverän EU‑lokalitet – och använder AI internt för att bevisa värdet innan vi tar det till kund.
   

  

 Som AI Solution Architect får du en nyckelroll i att designa, utveckla och implementera AI-lösningar som hjälper våra kunder att förverkliga sina idéer och skapa affärsvärde. Du arbetar nära kunder, säljorganisation och leveransteam – och är en teknisk rådgivare som omsätter affärsbehov till hållbara, skalbara och säkra AI-lösningar.
   

  

 Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden
   

  

* Designa AI-lösningar som kombinerar det bästa från molntjänster (t.ex. Azure AI, OpenAI, AWS) med open source-komponenter och ramverk (t.ex. LangChain, Hugging Face), med fokus på Microsoft Copilot, Azure AI och OpenAI
* Realisera kunders idéer och affärsbehov med hjälp av AI, LLM, RAG och agentbaserade lösningar
* Leda workshops, förstudier och tekniska diskussioner med kunder och interna team
* Skapa och implementera lösningar som integrerar data, analys och AI för att maximera affärsvärde
* Säkerställa att lösningar uppfyller krav på säkerhet, skalbarhet, kostnadseffektivitet och regelefterlevnad
* Driva och stödja modernisering och migrering av befintliga plattformar till AI-drivna och molnbaserade miljöer
* Vara mentor och tekniskt stöd för konsulter och leveransteam
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om den senaste AI-utvecklingen och bidra till Ivers erbjudanden och tjänsteutveckling


**Vad vi erbjuder:**
 På Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. Vi är inkluderande och strävar efter ett genuint samarbete mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi finns här för att inspirera dig till att nå dina yrkesmässiga mål. Vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden. Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser för att vi ska utvecklas. Vi på Iver ger samma löfte till våra kollegor som till våra kunder. Löftet är att alltid vara ”beside you”, ”behind you” och ”before you”. Vi kallar det för "The Iver way".
   

  

**Förmåner**
 📄 Collective agreement & secure employment conditions
   

  

 🏠 Hybrid working model
   

  

 💪 Wellness allowance
   

  

 👓 Computer glasses
   

  

 ⏳Time bank – 24 hours extra leave per year
   

  

 🩺 Private health insurance
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension (ITP) & flexible pension
   

  

**Kvalifikationer och erfarenhet:**
 Vi söker dig som kombinerar teknisk spets med stark affärsförståelse. Du är nyfiken, driver dig själv och kunden mot nya lösningar och har ett stort intresse för AI och datautveckling. Du är en god kommunikatör som kan göra komplex AI begriplig, och du förstår vikten av samarbete för att nå mål. Du har djup kompetens inom AI-teknik på moderna plattformar, och du rör dig obehindrat mellan färdiga tjänster (SaaS) och skräddarsydd kod. Du är van att skapa lösningar och driva projekt som ger verklig effekt och kan visa på flera fall där du varit ansvarig för att hjälpa kunder med AI i praktiken.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen bör du ha:
   

  

* Flera års erfarenhet som Solution Architect, Data/Analytics Architect eller liknande roll
* Djup kunskap om Microsoft AI-teknik (Copilot, Azure AI, OpenAI) och open-source AI-plattformar
* Praktisk erfarenhet av Open Source-stacken för AI (t.ex. Python, LangChain, Vektordatabaser och lokalt driftade modeller).
* Erfarenhet av arkitekturmönster för LLM-applikationer (RAG, Agents, Prompt Engineering).
* Bakgrund inom data och analytics, med djup förståelse för datastrukturer och dataplattformar
* Förmåga att designa lösningar för både publika moln och hybridmiljöer/container-plattformar
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt
* Relevant certifiering inom AI, cloud eller data är meriterande


**Placeringsort:** 
 Iver finns på 25 platser i Norden. För denna roll ser vi att du utgår från vårt kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg eller Malmö.
   

  

**Övrig information:**
 Vi arbetar med kunder inom alla branscher, inklusive säkerhetsklassade verksamheter. Bakgrundskontroll ingår i rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

**Ansök nu!**
 Urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Iver strävar efter jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Sista ansökningsdag 2026-02-01. Vid frågor om rollen, kontakta rekryterande chef Mattias Persson (mattias.persson@iver.se) eller TA Manager Jennie Vilhelmsson (jennie.vilhelmsson@iver.se)
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: Group Financial Controller
description:
We are on a mission to become the leading force in residential property management services. The global residential property management industry is currently undergoing a digital transformation and Odevo is at the forefront of this transformation. Our mission is to radically simplify living for families and individuals by delivering highly attractive and efficient property management services to building owners and associations as well as to residents. Our core belief is that digital technology combined with great people will play a central role in delivering a step change in how boards and residents experience property management.
   

  

 What we do matters to billions of people across the world. Residential real estate is the world’s largest asset class and buying a home is often the biggest investment a person or family will ever make. But the residential property management industry is lagging behind when it comes to customer focus and digitalization. That is why we formed Odevo.
   

  

 Over the past six years, leading property management companies in the US, UK, Nordics, Germany, Spain, Portugal, Italy, and Mexico have joined forces to form Odevo. In that time, our revenues have grown 60-fold, establishing us as one of the largest and fastest-growing international players in the industry. Our ambition is to continue to grow rapidly organically and by attracting additional companies to join us in both existing and new markets.
   

  

 We deliver our property management services with custom developed software to simplify living and make life easier for property owners, association boards, residents and very importantly our own property management professionals. We make complex topics such as managing property finances and the daily maintenance of buildings easy, and we automate time-consuming everyday tasks so people can spend more time on things that they really enjoy.
   

  

 We are now a 11 000 employee company with a start-up mentality. We aspire to break new ground through innovation, and we actively cultivate a workplace where we can grow as individuals and have fun while achieving great things together.
   

  

 To continue our ambitious growth journey, we are now looking for people who share our vision to join us on a journey that will continue to transform the property management industry on a global scale.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Do you thrive in a high-paced, fast-growing role where group accounting intertwines with acquisitions? Do you enjoy working in an agile team where you support each other, try new things and is committed to continuous development? If so, then this could be your next step!
   

  

 As a Group Financial Controller, you will be a key player in our ambitious group consolidation team. Working closely with the business and management, your contribution will have a significant and immediate impact.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop the onboarding process for newly acquired companies, ensuring smooth and efficient integration into our financial operations.
* Lead projects related to onboarding of acquired companies, including PPA, IFRS conversion, and coordination with external advisors.
* Collaborate with the Group Finance team to deliver accurate and timely financial reporting and consolidation on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis. Conduct analysis of P&L, balance sheet, and cash flow across our operating companies and markets.
* Guide and support local finance teams to promote development and ensure alignment with group processes.
* Contribute to the development and maintenance of Odevo’s accounting principles and consolidation system (AARO).
* Implement and maintain group financial reporting requirements in compliance with IFRS standards.
* Coordinate the internal audit process and collaborate effectively with external auditors to ensure compliance.


 Our agile work environment offers short decision-making paths, close collaboration, and a culture that encourages trying new ideas and enhancing processes over prolonged discussions.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

 You are a driven and curious individual who thrives in a dynamic environment. You enjoy high-paced settings and are excited to be part of a journey where both you and the company experience rapid growth.
   

  

 Self-driven, responsible, and well‑organized, you are a true team player who actively shares knowledge and supports colleagues.
   

  

 You work in an analytical, accurate, and solution‑focused way, and are eager to continuously learn and develop, both personally and professionally.
   

  

**About**
 While sharing our values and being excited about our journey is important, we believe that having
 **experience in the following areas will contribute to succeeding in this role:**
* University degree in accounting, finance or a related field
* Strong understanding of closing processes and consolidation principles; experience in a fast-growing PE-owned multinational organization is highly desirable.
* Background in group accounting or experience within a large organization, including involvement in acquisitions, consolidation and/or integration projects is considered a plus.
* Strong understanding of IFRS and relevant accounting regulations.
* Proficiency in Excel and experience with various ERP systems; familiarity with AARO is considered a plus.
* Strong communication skills in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.


 What we offer
   

  

* A key role in an agile and ambitious team with a high pace.
* The opportunity to be part of an exciting growth journey with frequent acquisitions.
* Short decision-making paths and the ability to influence our work processes.
* Strong development opportunities in both in breadth (M&A, integration, process improvement) and depth (advanced group accounting)
* Competitive compensation and benefits.


**Application**
 Does this sound like you?
   

  

 Please submit your
 **CV** 
 and a short
 **cover letter** 
 . Selection is ongoing, and the position will be filled as soon as we find the right person.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role, please contact:
 **Linnéa Berglund** 
 , Talent Partner at Odevo.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: SoC Architect ASIC
description:
**Join our Team**
**About The Opportunity**
 Ericsson’s Product Engineering Unit Silicon drives the architecture and development of Digital ASICs and SoCs that power current and future generations of mobile networks. Our Silicon System & Architecture organization defines system-level concepts, accelerator architectures, and micro-architectures that underpin Ericsson’s Radio and Compute product portfolios.
   

  

 You will join a highly skilled team of 7 senior technical leaders responsible for setting the direction of next-generation Digital ASICs. Together with the rest of the system team, the mission is to define accelerator solutions that improve radio and baseband performance, increase energy efficiency, and enable hardware–software co-optimization across the stack.
   

  

 This role is suited for a senior architect who thrives in early-phase definition, systemization of complex hardware accelerators, and alignment across multiple technical domains. Your contributions will directly strengthen and expand Ericsson’s accelerator leadership.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Define architecture and systemization for next-generation hardware accelerators, including matrix processors for AI/ML inference, signal processing, and radio workloads.
* Specify, justify, and evaluate new accelerator features with a focus on performance, determinism, and power efficiency.
* Drive micro-architecture development for accelerator blocks and subsystems and produce high-quality specifications used by design and verification teams.
* Collaborate with the Accelerator IP Program, SoC architects, and Radio/RAN Compute organizations to translate system requirements into ASIC-level architecture.
* Guide implementation teams throughout design, verification, and validation.
* Contribute to methodology improvements for modeling, architectural exploration, and system-level workflows.
* Work closely with technical leaders across the organization to align architectural direction, ensure feasibility, and realize system-level optimization goals.


**Essential**
**Skills You Bring**
* Master’s or PhD in Electronic Engineering or equivalent.
* Proven experience in systemization and architecture of hardware accelerators, ideally for real-time or high-performance systems.
* Strong background in advanced Digital ASIC/SoC development, from concept through specification to implementation support.
* Solid understanding of ASIC design flows, EDA environments, and modeling methodologies.
* Proficiency in VHDL and/or SystemVerilog.
* Strong programming capability in relevant languages (e.g., Python, Julia, MATLAB, C/C++).
* Excellent skills in linear algebra, neural networks, and signal-processing algorithms.
* Demonstrated technical leadership, with the ability to drive complex work both independently and collaboratively.
* Experience with GIT and modern development workflows.


**Can Be Learned in the Role**
* Ericsson-specific accelerator IP frameworks and architectural methodologies.
* ML toolchains (e.g., Llama or similar) as applied to ASIC accelerator design.
* Domain-specific radio and RAN Compute use-case optimization.


**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden || Stockholm/ Lund
   

  

**Primary Recruiter:** 
 Anitha Pulluru

title: EMEA Sales Director, ISV Embedded Solutions
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1,100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.ght re
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a
 **Sales Director, ISV Embedded Solutions** 
 in various locations to drive partnerships for licensing and embedding Ubuntu and Ubuntu Pro into software and SaaS solutions.
   

  

 Canonical supports ISV customers and alliances in building on Ubuntu and Ubuntu Pro, which helps them deliver fast, reliable, secure, compliant and consistent solutions.
   

  

 We offer the world's most extensive base of open source software, backed by comprehensive SLA support, FIPS-certified cryptographic compliance, and security commitments that meet HIPAA and FedRAMP standards. We are the top-rated operating system for developers. Partnering with every major public cloud provider, we ensure Ubuntu is optimized and seamlessly integrated with their unique services, making it easier for ISVs to deploy solutions confidently across multi-cloud environments. Additionally, we collaborate with leading server manufacturers, IoT providers, and silicon vendors to enable, optimize, and certify Ubuntu on their hardware. This makes Ubuntu an exceptional choice for ISVs selling physical appliances or traditional software solutions.
   

  

 The world's biggest brands in AI build on these Ubuntu Pro capabilities to ensure they stay focused on their product proposition rather than maintenance or compliance.
   

  

 Location: Multiple openings in the Americas and in EMEA time zones
   

  

**The role entails:**
 The
 **Sales Director, ISV Embedded Solutions** 
 will collaborate with Product, Alliances, Sales, Business Development, and Marketing colleagues to prospect into ISV accounts, introduce our offerings, help partners or potential customers develop their products to best leverage our portfolio. The successful candidate will:
   

  

* Drive embedded support and licensing sales with ISVs to exceed quarterly and annual bookings targets.
* Lead customer and partner relationships and interactions through all stages of the sales, customer success and support lifecycle.
* Deepen their understanding and engagement with the open source ecosystem.
* Identify and develop partnerships that support Canonical's strategic ambitions.
* Collaborate with product management to ensure fitness and enhancement of our platforms and solutions for ISVs.
* Negotiate contracts with new and existing ISV partners and customers.
* Shape our content and messaging for ISV partners and customers.


**What we are looking for in you**
* Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university.
* Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path.
* Ability to establish strategic relationships with large organisations at all levels
* A passion for technology and extensive experience with the software and SaaS industry, Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred), the open source ecosystem, cloud models, and container service offerings.
* Experience with lead generation and business development in the software sector.
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability.
* Outstanding business English writing and presentation skills.
* A personal drive to meet commitments and a track record of delivering beyond expectations.
* A commitment to leadership, skills development and mentorship.
* An appreciation of diversity and effectiveness in a multicultural, multi-national organisation.
* Ability to travel internationally twice a year for company events up to two weeks long.


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographic location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person.
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year.
* Annual compensation review.
* Recognition rewards.
* Annual holiday leave.
* Maternity and paternity leave.
* Employee Assistance Programme.
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues.
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events.


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Freshservice-expert med stort kundfokus
description:
**Var med och forma framtidens IT- och medarbetarupplevelser!** 




  





 På Synerity satsar vi stort på Freshservice – plattformen som moderniserar hur organisationer levererar och utvecklar sina IT- och supporttjänster. Efterfrågan växer snabbt bland organisationer som vill automatisera, standardisera och höja sin servicenivå – och vi är med och leder den förändringen.
 



 Vi söker nu dig – en nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och engagerad Freshservice-specialist – som vill kombinera teknik och processer till lösningar som höjer kvaliteten, effektiviteten och upplevelsen för användarna.
 



 Hos oss får du arbeta i framkant av ITSM/ESM, automation och AI-lösningar i Freshservice-plattformen, i nära dialog med kunder som verkligen vill utvecklas.
 



  





**Om Synerity** 




 Synerity är experter på ärendehantering, kundservice och automationslösningar för medelstora och större organisationer. Vi erbjuder konsulttjänster inom IT Service Management, Enterprise Service Management, automationslösningar och relaterade plattformar.
 



 Hos oss har varje medarbetare en betydande roll – vi vill att jobbet ska kännas både utmanande och utvecklande. Vi arbetar agilt och tvärfunktionellt med kundfokus, och vi tror på balans i livet, frihet under ansvar och en kultur där mångfald och inkludering värdesätts.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Freshservice-specialist blir du navet mellan kundens verksamhet, deras processer och tekniken de förvaltar.
 



  





 Du hjälper kunder att bygga moderna, effektiva och användarvänliga serviceupplevelser – från strategi och design till implementation, integration och utbildning.
