title: INFRASTRUCTURE ARCHITECT
description:
**FÖRETAG**


Stena Metall AB

**PLATS**


Göteborg, Sverige

**SISTA ANSÖKNINGSDATUM**


2026-01-28

**YRKESOMRÅDE**


IT



  
Are you passionate about designing infrastructure that enables business success and drives the transition to cloud solutions? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!



As an Infrastructure Architect, you will ensure a robust, secure, and cost-effective IT infrastructure that supports our business needs and accelerates our journey toward cloud-based environments. You will play a key role in shaping our infrastructure strategy and delivering solutions that combine reliability with innovation.


**Using your potential, you will:**


* Design and document infrastructure solutions, including networks, security, virtualization, storage, backup, and disaster recovery.
* Contribute to roadmap development and participate in strategic decision-making.
* Collaborate with solution architects, operations teams, and business stakeholders.
* Ensure compliance with security standards and regulatory requirements.
* Support the development of hybrid and cloud-based environments (Azure, AWS).


**It starts with you!**  

We are seeking an Infrastructure Architect who is:


* Skilled at balancing stability with innovation in complex IT environments.
* Experienced in driving infrastructure initiatives across diverse teams and organizations
* Curious and driven — you don’t wait for things to happen; you make them happen.
* You are a true team player with strong communication skills and the ability to engage effectively with a wide range of stakeholders.


In addition, we believe you have


* An academic degree and 5+ years of experience as a cloud and/or infrastructure architect or similar role.
* Deep understanding of IT infrastructure design, including networks, security, virtualization, storage, backup, and disaster recovery.
* Knowledge of architecture frameworks, governance models, and IT standards.
* Familiarity with compliance, security requirements, and regulatory frameworks.
* Practical experience with traditional infrastructure and cloud platforms (Azure, AWS), including hybrid environments.
* Ability to structure, document, and analyze infrastructure requirements in complex organizations.
* Fluent in English and Swedish, both spoken and written.


**Why Stena Metall?**  

At Stena Metall Group IT, we know that people make the difference. You will be part of a dynamic, innovative team that values collaboration and is dedicated to creating a positive and inclusive work environment.



Stena Metall Group IT is a part of Stena Metall, a family-owned company with a long-term perspective on both the business and the employees. Together, we create value every day! Your contributions will directly influence our ability to achieve our business strategies and goals.


**Ready to Make a Difference?**
  
**ANSÖKAN**
-----------


Hope we have caught your attention. Join our ride today and help us, by using your potential, to make a difference and form a sustainable tomorrow! We look forward to your application as soon as possible, selection will be running continuously. We do background check in the recrutmentprocess  

  

**Sista ansökningsdatum:**  

2026-01-28
**DATASKYDDSDEKLARATION**
-------------------------


Stena Metall AB har åtagit sig att skydda och respektera din integritet. Vi vill att du ska känna dig trygg när vi behandlar dina personuppgifter. För att säkerställa en hög skyddsnivå för de personuppgifter du delar med oss kommer vi inte att behandla de ansökningar som skickas till oss via e-post. Skicka in din ansökan enligt instruktionerna.

title: Receptionist Scandic Triangeln
description:
**Nu söker vi en Receptionist till Scandic Triangeln.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad är innebär rollen?**



Du som arbetar i receptionen är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning.


Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.


Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och helger).


**Vem är du?**



För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.


Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.


**Information om tjänsten**



Tjänsten är en visstidsanställning på deltid.


Varannan helg


Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!



Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------

Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

Enable "functional cookies" to watch the video


...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.
company_description: Nordiskt hotellföretag i världsklass som skapar enastående upplevelser för de många människorna. 16 000 medarbetar, 280 hotell i 6 länder.

title: Senior Analyst, Mandiant, Threat Intelligence (English, Swedish)
description:
Note: Google's hybrid workplace includes remote and in-office roles. By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following:  

  

**In-office locations: Stockholm, Sweden.**  

**Remote location(s): Sweden.**### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience in a customer-facing investigative role in cyber security (e.g., network forensics analyst, threat intelligence analyst).
* Experience with project management.
* Experience engaging with, and presenting to, technical stakeholders and executive leaders.
* Experience of working in a government or military environment, leveraging and developing CTI for network, host and log analysis, to enable the detection and response to cyber threats.
* Ability to communicate in English and Swedish fluently in order to work in this client-facing role.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* 7 years of experience evaluating forensic reports of electronic media, packet capture, log data, malware triage, or enterprise-level information security operations.
* Experience with CTI methodologies and application within cyber security organizations.
* Experience in the consumption, processing, and analysis of tactical Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI) within an operational environment, supporting monitoring, detection, and response capabilities.
* Experience with standard network logging formats, network management systems and network security monitoring systems, and security information and event management.

**About the job**
-----------------


In this role, you will support Mandiant’s Advanced Intelligence Access (AIA) program. The AIA program enables customers, via dedicated cyber analyst, access to the totality of Mandiant Threat Intelligence, including raw data. You will ensure the delivery of actionable intelligence to each customer’s security or operational environments in order to drive decision making and action. You will also act as a conduit to Mandiant’s extensive network of cybersecurity, threat intelligence, and information operations professionals. This is a client-facing position.


This position requires onsite client-facing work 3-4 days a week in Stockholm.


Part of Google Cloud, Mandiant is a recognized leader in dynamic cyber defense, threat intelligence and incident response services. Mandiant's cybersecurity expertise has earned the trust of security professionals and company executives around the world. Our unique combination of renowned frontline experience responding to some of the most complex breaches, nation-state grade threat intelligence, machine intelligence, and the industry's best security validation ensures that Mandiant knows more about today's advanced threats than anyone.**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Embed within and build understanding of customers Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI) requirements, identifying their needs and opportunities for deployment of CTI within their operations to have defensive impact.
* Track, research and contribute CTI analysis within Google Threat Intelligence, addressing customer priority threat concerns.
* Write intelligence reports against customer requirements, appropriate for their intelligence analysts or readers.
* Generate CTI and perform analysis of customer data, taking their bespoke sources to identify threat activity, or to build and automate problem-solving workflows.
* Support the integration of CTI into customer's security processes and technologies, including SIEM and Threat Intelligence Platform (TIP) systems, enabling customer SoC analysts and Hunt teams to deploy and leverage Google's CTI.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Senior Hardware Engineer
description:
Do you want to work with **advanced digital hardware design** in projects where technical depth, real products, and customer impact truly matter?


Qamcom Research and Technology is an innovation hub specializing in intelligent, connected systems. We offer expert consulting services and product development in areas such as sensors, radars, signal and image processing, embedded hardware and software, multimodal AI analytics, wireless communication, edge-cloud infrastructure, and functional safety. Our team possesses the comprehensive skills necessary to develop complete products for serial production. We can take ownership of every aspect of the development chain from the initial design to the final product.


We are now looking for a **Senior Digital Hardware Designer** with strong experience in **board-level digital design** to strengthen our hardware team.

### **About the Role**


In this role, you will design and develop **high-performance digital hardware systems** that push the limits of what is technically possible. You will work closely with customers and internal experts, contributing your knowledge throughout the entire development cycle — from early architecture and design decisions to verification and product acceptance. The focus is on **CPU/SoC-based systems, high-speed digital interfaces, and signal integrity**. This is a role for engineers who enjoy **technical responsibility, complexity, and real engineering challenges**.

**Responsibilities include**

* Responsibilities include  

Design and develop digital hardware systems from requirements to production
* Drive system architecture and schematic design for CPU/SoC-based boards, including power distribution and clocking considerations
* Make key design decisions for memories, Ethernet, clocking, and high-speed digital interfaces, with attention to signal integrity and robustness
* Collaborate closely with customers to define requirements and robust, system-level solutions
* Participate in design reviews, verification, lab work, and acceptance testing, including board bring-up and debugging

### **Qualifications**

* BSc or MSc in Electrical Engineering or equivalent
* **PHD or 6+ years of hands-on experience in** **mixed signal hardware design**
* Proven experience with **CPU/SoCs, DDR memories, Flash, Ethernet PHYs/switches**
* Strong understanding of **signal integrity** in high-speed digital designs and SI/PI simulations
* Experience with **schematic design** for complex digital systems
* Comfortable working in a hardware lab with modern measurement equipment
* Ability to work independently, take technical ownership, and drive work forward
* Fluent in English
* Swedish work permit

### **Meritorious**

* Experience with SI/PI simulation tools (IBIS/SPICE-based)
* PCB layout experience (e.g. Altium, Cadence)
* Knowledge of digital interfaces such as I2C, SPI, CAN, Ethernet, USB, MIPI
* Basic programming for test systems (e.g. Python)
* Experience with EMC/EMI and regulatory requirements

### **Qamcom offers**


At Qamcom, we foster a collaborative and inclusive environment where experienced professionals and specialists work together on cutting-edge system solutions. Our in-house projects span hardware, software, and algorithms for industrial and MedTech applications, allowing us to apply advanced technology in real-world product development.


We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team because we know that different perspectives drive innovation. So if you’re passionate about technology and bring relevant skills and experience, we want to hear from you. Your unique background and approach could be exactly what we need.

**Additionally, a sample of our benefits are listed below:**

* Flexible office hours and hybrid-remote working model.
* Possibility to bank extra hours worked and convert them to additional leave days.
* Competitive insurance and pension program.
* Generous parental leave (90% of the salary).
* Wellness benefits (5000 SEK/year).
* Bicycle leasing and employee car options (electric or hybrid).
* Fixed salary with annual salary reviews.


Join us at Qamcom, where your expertise will contribute to shaping the future of technology and innovation.

title: Project Manager
description:
**Essential requirements:**  

* Proven Project Management Experience (4+ years) in Microsoft 365 Environments
* Demonstrated experience managing complex IT projects within the Microsoft 365 ecosystem, including planning, execution, and delivery.
* Hands-on Experience with Cloud / VDI Transformations
* Direct involvement in large-scale cloud transformation initiatives, ideally including Windows 365, VDI, DaaS, or similar virtual desktop solutions.
* Strong IT Transformation & Migration Expertise
* Proven track record of leading global IT transformation projects, with a strong understanding of cloud adoption challenges, migration strategies, and minimizing business disruption.
* Stakeholder & Governance Leadership
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with experience driving alignment across cross-functional teams and ensuring governance throughout project delivery.
* Structured, Proactive Problem Solver
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify risks early, manage dependencies, and proactively mitigate issues during implementation.

 **Meritorious:**  

* Windows 365 or Desktop-as-a-Service Implementation Experience
* Prior hands-on experience specifically delivering Windows 365 or other DaaS solutions from PoC through production.
* Operational Readiness & Service Design Experience
* Experience defining operational models, roles, architecture, documentation, training materials, and support processes for enterprise IT services.
* Experience with PoC Development and Testing
* Background in managing proof-of-concept activities, testing phases, and translating findings into scalable production solutions.
* Experience in Employee Experience or End-User Computing Domains
* Familiarity with end-user computing, employee experience platforms, or user onboarding initiatives in large organizations.

 **Please explain how you meet all the requirements** **when applying.**

title: PCB Designer
description:
Qamcom Research and Technology is a dynamic hub of innovation, offering specialist consulting services and product development with an emphasis on intelligent, connected systems. Our expertise spans a wide range of areas including sensors and radars, image and signal processing, embedded hardware and software, multi-modal AI analytics, wireless communication systems, application software, edge-cloud infrastructure, and functional safety.


Our team combines deep technical expertise with a collaborative mindset, allowing us to develop complete products for serial production. We take ownership of every aspect of the development chain, from initial design to final product.

**About the Role**


We are looking for a skilled and detail-oriented PCB Designer to join our teamat Qamcom. In this role, you will be hired as a consultant responsible for creating, optimizing, and verifying PCB layouts for a variety of products. You’ll collaborate closely with mechanical engineers, hardware engineers, firmware developers, and project managers to ensure high-quality designs that meet performance, manufacturability, and reliability requirements.

**Responsibilities**

* Create and maintain PCB layouts based on electrical schematics and design requirements.
* Work with cross-functional teams to refine design specifications and resolve layout-related issues.
* Ensure designs comply with industry standards, EMC/EMI requirements, and manufacturing constraints.
* Perform design verification, including DFM/DFT checks.
* Prepare fabrication and assembly documentation.
* Support prototype builds and assist with troubleshooting as needed.

**Qualifications**

* Minimum 6 years of industrial experience.
* University degree in a relevant field (e.g., electronics engineering).
* Proven experience with PCB design tools (e.g., Cadence OrCad, Altium Designer, KiCad, or similar).
* Strong understanding of PCB stackup, routing strategies, high-speed design, and signal integrity.
* Experience with EMC/EMI considerations and design best practices.
* Ability to interpret schematics and work closely with hardware engineers.
* Attention to detail and a structured, analytical approach.
* Good communication skills and ability to work in a collaborative environment.
* Swedish citizenship is required.

**Nice-to-Have**

* Experience with rigid-flex or HDI designs.
* Familiarity with electronics manufacturing processes.
* Knowledge of scripting or automation for PCB tools.


If you're passionate about PCB design and want to make an impact through high-quality engineering work, we'd love to hear from you!

**Qamcom Offers**  

At Qamcom, we foster a collaborative and inclusive environment where experienced professionals and specialists work together on cutting-edge system solutions. Our in-house projects span hardware, software, and algorithms for industrial and MedTech applications, allowing you to apply advanced technology in real-world product development.


We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team because we know that different perspectives drive innovation. If you’re passionate about PCB design and bring relevant skills and experience, we want to hear from you. Your unique background and approach could be exactly what we need.

**Additionally, a sample of general benefits are listed below:**

* Competitive insurance and pension program
* Generous parental leave (90% of the salary)
* Wellness policy (5000 SEK/year)
* Leasing of a bicycle and option for an employee car (electric or hybrid)
* Fixed salary with annual salary reviews

title: Lead Architect within eHealth
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in eHealth with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our eHealth solutions supports health care professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish healthcare. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.*

**The position**


Are you ready to shape the future of healthcare technology? Join our Architect team and be at the forefront of Cambio's technical innovation. As a Lead Architect, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our products and services. Our team is dedicated to driving technical excellence, and work with architecture from a holistic perspective, from business architecture to deployment and seamless integrations. Cambio is very proactive in using AI to deliver better customer applications and to be more efficient.


As a Lead Architect, you are the bridge between our strategy and technology for a specific product or competence area in our portfolio.


Your responsibilities include:

* Collaborating with the product manager to steer the product in the right direction
* Creating and maintaining the technical roadmap, by guiding software architects and participating in our increment planning, giving clear goals and directives for development focus going forward.
* You run the Product Architecture Board where architectural decisions are taken within the product.
* You are a part of the Enterprise Architecture team, consisting of other lead architects and enterprise architects.
* Together, we set guidelines and principles for architecture and technology at Cambio, helping to guide the organization towards our future vision.


We are a diverse group that values communication and collaboration and having fun together.

**About you**


To feel comfortable in this position, you have probably had a background as a software or solution architect and would like to take next step. You also at this point have acquired the ability to handle multiple stakeholders with different needs, at various seniority levels (from C-suite to developers). You should be comfortable in setting direction and vision, helping others to execute it, and be able to act as a mentor and coach to other architects. Presentation skills and communication skills are key as you will need to collaborate and influence those around you, all with the goal of reaching the future vision of your product. Our team values soft skills as much as technical skills.

**Requirements**

* Technical background, preferably as an architect
* Leadership experience, preferably as an informal leader
* Comfortable presenting and interacting with stakeholders at various levels, from developers to CIOs and present roadmaps for large audience
* Experience presenting and communicating ideas, visions, or guidelines at various levels to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Fluency in Swedish and English

**It's a bonus if you**

* Have experience working in a regulated domain, for example with MDR or CE-marking.
* Have experience of a complex product’s life cycle and the processes associated with it.
* Have experience in the health technology domain.

We are growing in several areas and need reinforcement. It is a bonus requirement if you have experience from and interest in being the lead architect in one or more of the following areas:

* Cambio platform: A standards-based health data platform built on openEHR, enabling secure and interoperable access to clinical data. As Lead Architect, this involves governing platform architecture, data models and integration patterns to ensure scalable, reusable and vendor-independent use of healthcare data.
* Container Platform (OpenShift): Standardizes application delivery using containers to improve cost efficiency, portability and operational manageability. As a Lead Architect, this includes defining target architectures, setting OpenShift standards, and guiding the transition of existing applications to scalable and resilient container-based platforms.
* Private Cloud & Security: Defines and governs the network-centric architecture of a private cloud for healthcare applications. As Lead Architect, this involves setting principles for tenant isolation, network segmentation and secure traffic flows, and ensuring security and operational controls across development, deployment and operations.
* Frontend: Defines the architecture for modern, secure and accessible healthcare clients built on standardized frontend frameworks. As Lead Architect, this includes guiding the modernization of the client landscape, setting frontend standards, and ensuring consistent user experiences, performance and compliance across applications such as Min Hälsa and integrations with 1177.

**Additional information:** We will start the selection process at the en of January

**Place of employment**: Linköping or Stockholm

**Scope**: Full-time, hybrid work model (three days per week in-office)

**Form of employment:** Permanent employment, 6 months trial period


We review applications and conduct interviews on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible via the link.  

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**

**CAMBIO- FOR A HEALTHIER TOMORROW**


Welcome to a company where healthcare is improved every day. Here you will work with leading technology in a collaborative, trusting and empowering environment where your contribution will be appreciated and celebrated. In our caring culture you will have the opportunity to pursue different paths of professional growth. Seize the opportunity to do the most important work of your life**.** Read more about us **here!**

 **A healthier tomorrow also means taking care of those who make it possible -**explore our employee benefits


Learn more about our recruitment process here.


Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at our career site.
